revisionDesc.change: Pull translation out of APIS record.

div.ab: To the praepositus of the 2nd district from the comarchs of the village ... We propose and present the two men mentioned next, since they are well off and servicable for the comarchy. We answer for them and present them without any reproach. ... When they have been questioned we will agree. ... In the consulate of our lords Licinius Augustus, for the 5th time, and Crispus, the most renowned Caesar, for the 1st time, on Mesore the 19th. We propose these for comarchs, as it has been presented. I wrote on behalf of those being illiterate.

listBibl.bibl: P. Got. 5 BL VII, 61 (for the date); BL VIII, 139 (line 11 and for provenance); TM 17555
